org.opends.sdk.ldif
Interface LDIFWriter

All Superinterfaces:
Closeable, Flushable
All Known Implementing Classes:
LDIFOutputStreamWriter
public interface LDIFWriter
extends Closeable, Flushable

An interface for writing LDIF change records to a data source.

See Also:
RFC 2849 - The LDAP Data Interchange Format (LDIF) - Technical Specification

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes this LDIF writer, flushing it first.
 void flush()
          Flushes this LDIF writer so that any buffered data is written immediately to underlying stream, flushing the stream if it is also Flushable.
 LDIFWriter writeAttrValRecord(AttributeSequence entry)
          Writes the provided AttributeSequence to this LDIF writer as an attribute value record containing the distinguished name and attributes of the entry, but no change type or controls.
 LDIFWriter writeChangeRecord(AddRequest change)
          Writes the provided AddRequest to this LDIF writer as a change record containing the distinguished name, any controls included with the request, the change type add, and any attributes included in the request.
 LDIFWriter writeChangeRecord(AttributeSequence change)
          Writes the provided AttributeSequence to this LDIF writer as a change record containing the distinguished name, the change type add, and any attributes included in the sequence, but no controls.
 LDIFWriter writeChangeRecord(DeleteRequest change)
          Writes the provided DeleteRequest to this LDIF writer as a change record containing the distinguished name, any controls included with the request, and the change type delete.
 LDIFWriter writeChangeRecord(ModifyDNRequest change)
          Writes the provided ModifyDNRequest to this LDIF writer as a change record containing the distinguished name, any controls included with the request, the change type modrdn, and any additional parameters included in the request.
 LDIFWriter writeChangeRecord(ModifyRequest change)
          Writes the provided ModifyRequest to this LDIF writer as a change record containing the distinguished name, any controls included with the request, the change type modify, and any modifications included in the request.
 LDIFWriter writeComment(CharSequence comment)
          Writes the provided CharSequence to this LDIF writer as a comment.
 

Method Detail

close

void close()
           throws IOException
Closes this LDIF writer, flushing it first. Closing a previously closed LDIF writer has no effect.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while closing.

flush

void flush()
           throws IOException
Flushes this LDIF writer so that any buffered data is written immediately to underlying stream, flushing the stream if it is also Flushable.

If the intended destination of this stream is an abstraction provided by the underlying operating system, for example a file, then flushing the stream guarantees only that bytes previously written to the stream are passed to the operating system for writing; it does not guarantee that they are actually written to a physical device such as a disk drive.

Specified by:
flush in interface Flushable
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while flushing.

writeAttrValRecord

LDIFWriter writeAttrValRecord(AttributeSequence entry)
                              throws IOException,
                                     NullPointerException
Writes the provided AttributeSequence to this LDIF writer as an attribute value record containing the distinguished name and attributes of the entry, but no change type or controls.

Parameters:
entry - The AttributeSequence to be written as an attribute value record.
Returns:
A reference to this LDIF writer.
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while writing the attribute value record.
NullPointerException - If entry was null.

writeChangeRecord

LDIFWriter writeChangeRecord(AddRequest change)
                             throws IOException,
                                    NullPointerException
Writes the provided AddRequest to this LDIF writer as a change record containing the distinguished name, any controls included with the request, the change type add, and any attributes included in the request.

Parameters:
change - The AddRequest to be written as a change record.
Returns:
A reference to this LDIF writer.
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while writing the change record.
NullPointerException - If change was null.

Parameters:

Returns:
A reference to this LDIF writer.
